imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimal map placeholder card background with faint streets and two red location pins (map-placeholder-home.dim_900x600.png)
- Minimal map placeholder with a curved route line between two pins (map-placeholder-route.dim_900x600.png)
- Food bowl/plate photo-style placeholder on neutral background (food-placeholder.dim_900x600.png)
- Simple eco/leaf app logo icon, flat style, green tones (app-logo.dim_512x512.png)

existing_features.title: Recreate the mobile app UI shown in the uploaded prototype images as a responsive web UI, matching the overall layout and components: green top app bar, light content area, rounded cards, and a bottom navigation with tabs for Home and History.

Implement the four primary screens depicted in the images with matching structure and English UI text: (1) Home/Welcome with 'Food Wastage Solution', welcome message, 'Add Food' CTA, and a 'Nearby NGOs' map preview card; (2) Add Food screen with image preview and fields for Title, Quantity, Date, Time, and a 'Post' button; (3) NGO Alert screen with alert text, map/route preview, and a 'Track' button; (4) History screen listing posted items with date/time and quantity, plus bottom navigation.
Provide the 'Add Food' functionality UI in multiple different form variations (different forms/layouts) while keeping the same fields and actions, and allow the user to switch between them in the UI.

Implement a lightweight demo data model in the UI so that posting a food item adds it to History, and the NGO Alert screen can display a sample alert for the most recent post (no real maps/GPS required).

Apply a coherent, eco-focused visual theme consistent with the prototype: green primary color, neutral background, simple typography, and subtle shadows/rounded corners; keep the style consistent across all screens (avoid blue/purple as primary colors).
Add the required generated images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the UI where the prototype shows an image preview and map placeholders.

new_feature_requests.summary: Recreate the referenced UI and provide it in different form variations/layouts
